subject: Critical Thinking
title: Ad Hominem: Attacking the Person, Not the Argument
description: A fast breakdown of Ad Hominem: Attacking the Person, Not the Argument for builders.

hook.text: 'You're not a scientist, so your climate data doesn't count.' The data is either valid or it'sn't, regardless of who.

buildup.text: Ad hominem: attacking the person making the argument instead of addressing the argument itself.

discovery.text: It comes in flavors: abusive (you're stupid), circumstantial (you're biased), and tu quoque (you do it too).

twist.text: Sometimes character IS relevant â€“ a pathological liar's testimony matters less.

climax.text: Ad hominem is the most common fallacy in political debate.

punchline.text: Attack the argument, not the arguer. Or admit you can't.

quiz.question: When is ad hominem a fallacy?
options: When character attacks replace engagement with the actual argument
